primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of elemental anxiety (Chaos) to a state of peace/faith through the self-announcement of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus appears in forms that are not immediately recognizable.
Jesus and his 'do not fear' continue to be uttered and will finally utter us beyond our fear.

object.identificatie: The 'Or' of complete assurance / Deliverance from Chaos

zender.identificatie: The God of the Old Testament (Yahweh of the Exile)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus speaks the cadences of the God who presides even in the chaos
I am YAHWEH, who made all things.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Disciples / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: The place where we all live.
The people with whom we minister.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver who is currently stuck in the role of a failing Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: The bread of life is thrown into the face of the storm of death
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, and His Word is the Helper/Instrument.

tegenstander.identificatie: Chaos (Das Nichtige) and the Hardened Heart
tekstueel_bewijs: The crushing, irresistible force of disorder
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a moral lapse but 'Das Nichtige'—an ontological threat that 'water always wins' against human effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to manage the storm through 'straining' and 'middle-class fascinations' with guilt management.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciples / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is exposed as a failure ('straining without success') to make room for the primary program (Grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Yahweh → Deliverance from Chaos → The Frightened Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Utterance → Jesus ← Das Nichtige/Hard Hearts

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus appears in forms that are not immediately recognizable.
Jesus offers to us the Or of his complete assurance.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: They strained against the adverse wind.
We have devised ways of forgiveness.
They did not understand about the loaves.

voorbeelden: They had not thought to call out for him.
They did not understand about the loaves.
Storms are always too strong for us.
He is more than a match for our fear.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of human power (Pouvoir-faire) in the face of Chaos and the supreme power of Jesus' utterance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Storm) to ~S2 (Calmness), then reveals ~S1 (Hard hearts) to show that only S1 (Jesus' ongoing utterance) can resolve the tension.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is not resolved by human 'water walking' but by the persistent 'utterance' of Jesus that continues despite human hardness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Chaos is described as bottomless and beyond measure.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total inability (straining without success) and positions Jesus as the sole Subject of the rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Be who you are. Be who you are. Be who you are.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of the rescue
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus and his 'do not fear' continue to be uttered and will finally utter us beyond our fear.
Das Nichtige, the crushing, irresistible force of disorder.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are not models to follow but mirrors of our own failure and hard-heartedness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jesus is the Creator who acts where the disciples fail.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'managing the storm' and a shift toward listening.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic rescue; faith is a response to an external Word, not a self-generated power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon masterfully integrates the feeding of the loaves with the storm miracle to show a unified narrative of divine abundance vs. human scarcity.
spanning_punten: The imperative 'Be who you are' briefly shifts the Subject to the hearer, though it is immediately grounded in 'because I have addressed you'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The wind subsides, having met its match. The storm is defeated.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'storm-stiller' who enables the utterance to be heard.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is linked to 'Egypt' and 'Pharaoh'—a state of bondage rather than just mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly identifies the human as an incompetent Subject and Jesus as the competent Subject who brings the Object (Peace/Assurance).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance as it serves the grace-orientation.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to emphasize that the 'Savoir' (understanding the loaves) is also a gift of grace, not a cognitive achievement.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Chaos) is already sufficiently cosmic.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Jesus speaks) strictly precedes and enables Ethics (Be who you are).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented homiletics. It refuses to turn the disciples into heroes and keeps the active verbs firmly in the hands of the Creator-Son.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of Isaiah's 'cadences,' Greimas' analysis shows these cadences function as the 'Helper' that grants the Subject (Jesus) the power to transform the Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the meaning of 'loaves,' but semiotics shows how the 'loaves' act as a narrative link between the power of creation and the power over chaos.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'storm' is not just a setting but an 'Opponent' that the human Subject is structurally incapable of defeating, necessitating a 'Subject-switch' to Christ.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'millimeter' between verses 50 and 51 as the semiotic space of decision/response.
